thread.title: Uttarakhand High Court declares river Ganga ‘first living entity of India’
thread.title_full: Uttarakhand High Court declares river Ganga ‘first living entity of India’

author: FE Online
title: Uttarakhand High Court declares river Ganga ‘first living entity of India’
text:
Uttarakhand High Court declares river Ganga ‘first living entity of India’ Uttarakhand High Court declares river Ganga ‘first living entity of India’ Ganga has been recognised as the 'first living entity of India'. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Updated: March 20, 2017 4:18 PM Along with Ganges, river Yamuna has also been declared a living entity.(PTI) 
In first of its kind decision, Uttarakhand High Court on Monday recognised river Ganga as the ‘first living entity of India’. Along with Ganges, river Yamuna has also been declared a living entity. As per the decision, the rivers will now be entitled to all rights available to humans as per the constitution, Jansatta reported. 
Further inputs awaited
